channel.title: Help With My Server Read this plz
channel.description:
i have downloaded tons of sources trying to get it to work... i have no-ip jdk and i set my envirement varibles...
and edited the run and compile....
i click compile first it sais it compiled not u need jdk or watever
than i do run and it sais completed and has a wole menu that opens for like muting like an admin panel..
so i use mopar and put my server ip and still wont work and yes no ip is open[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 11, 2009, 05:35:20 pm[/size][hr]and my pc does reconize java

item.title: Help With My Server Read this plz
item.dc:creator: @kpop kpop
item.description:
@kpop wrote:

[ul][li]Open command prompt and type “ipconfig”[/li]
[li]Look for where it says default gateway and type that set of numbers into your internet browser.[/li]
[li]Look for virtual servers (if you cant find it it may say something different)[/li]
[li]add the port 43594[/li]
[li]put your ip in the ip area and save settings.[/li][/ul]

if that doesnt work you may have the wrong port set,
if all that fails and you know your port is correct and your no-ip is functioning and your portforward is working, follow 'Lewk’s guide on µTorrent

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

this is especially helpful for people with linksys routers.

Read full topic
item.source: Help With My Server Read this plz

item.title: Help With My Server Read this plz
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

127.0.0.1 is the ip you ‘NEED’ to use to connect to your server, unless you do a bunch of bullshit after portforwarding, i find this much easier then whatever you have to do after portforwarding, your just connecting to your local ipaddress.

oh well if this is wrong it’s just and opinion.

TY alot it worked Smiley i portfowarded perfectly

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:11, topic:308015”]127.0.0.1 is the ip you ‘NEED’ to use to connect to your server, unless you do a bunch of bullshit after portforwarding, i find this much easier then whatever you have to do after portforwarding, your just connecting to your local ipaddress.

oh well if this is wrong it’s just and opinion.[/quote]

you have a point scape-

K i admit, i failed at portforwarding but i finally found out after like 2 months sadly but yes if u host a server THE OWNER the coder like the hoster which is you u need to connect either with no ip or 127.0.0.1 because the hoster cant connect with his own ip unless u go through the bullshit like scape- said.

item.title: Help With My Server Read this plz
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

dff280:

wireless router umm its linksys im not very sure i may need to portfoward

If your internet isn’t connected directly to your desktop/laptop then you most likely need to portforward. You can search Moparscape forums with the search bar for a tutorial on this one, I’m very sure there’s one. If not, google!

Hope this helped, that’s what i aim for.

Read full topic

item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

dff280:

why? thats not my servers ip?

127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, 127.000.000.1 and 000.000.000 are all local IP’s.
